chunks.title: Regulation 1 - Short title
chunks.text:
This regulation may be cited as the Taxation Administration Regulation 2022.
Commencement

chunks.title: Regulation 2 - Commencement
chunks.text:
This regulation commences on 2 September 2022.
Definitions

chunks.title: Regulation 3 Definitions "BPAY facility"
chunks.text:
"BPAY facility" means a facility by that name offered by BPAY Pty Limited ACN
Regulation 079 137 518.

chunks.title: Regulation 3 Definitions "payroll tax"
chunks.text:
"payroll tax" means payroll tax chargeable under the Payroll Tax Act 1971,
section 10.
Prescribed methods of paymentâAct, s 29

chunks.title: Regulation 4 - Prescribed methods of paymentâAct, s 29
Regulation 5 - Electronic paymentâAct, s 29A
chunks.text:
For section 29A (4) of the Act, definition
"prescribed electronic way", the following electronic ways are prescribedâ
     (a) BPAY facility;
     (b) direct debit;
     (c) electronic funds transfer.
Prescribed rate of interest for general refunds, unpaid tax interest and
overpaymentsâAct, ss 39, 54, 61 and 61A

chunks.title: Regulation 6 - Prescribed rate of interest for general refunds, unpaid tax interest and overpaymentsâAct, ss 39, 54, 61 and 61A
chunks.main_structural_heading: Prescribed rate of interest for general refunds, unpaid tax interest and overpaymentsâAct, ss 39, 54, 61 and 61A
chunks.text:
(1) The prescribed rate of interest for a financial year is an annual
     rate equal to the sum ofâ
          (a) for sections 39 (4) (b) (ii) and 54 (2) of the Act
          âthe 90-day bank bill yield rate for the financial year
          and 8%; and
          (b) for sections 61 (3) and 61A (3) of the Act âthe 90-
          day bank bill yield rate for the financial year.
     (2) The
     "90-day bank bill yield rate" for a financial year is the monthly
     average yield of 90-day bank accepted bills for the month of May in
     the preceding financial year, rounded to the nearest second decimal
     point, published by the Reserve Bank of Australia on its website.
     (3) For section 54 (3) (b) (i) of the Act, Sunday is prescribed.
When payments are receivedâAct, s 40

chunks.title: Regulation 7 - When payments are receivedâAct, s 40
chunks.text:
(1) For section 40 (1) (b) of the Act, the time prescribed is when
     the payment is credited to an accountâ
          (a) operated by the commissioner with a financial
          institution; and
          (b) used to perform the commissionerâs functions under
          section 8 of the Act.
     (2) However, if the payment is later dishonoured, the payment is
     taken not to have been received by the commissioner.
Waiver of tax law liabilityâAct, s 43

chunks.title: Regulation 8 - Waiver of tax law liabilityâAct, s 43
chunks.main_structural_heading: Waiver of tax law liabilityâAct, s 43
chunks.text:
For section 43 (1) of the Act, $20.00 is prescribed.
Recognised laws and corresponding commissionersâAct, s 78

chunks.title: Regulation 9 - Recognised laws and corresponding commissionersâAct, s 78
chunks.main_structural_heading: Recognised laws and corresponding commissionersâAct, s 78
chunks.text:
(1) A law stated in schedule 1 is a recognised law for the Act.
     (2) A person holding the following office is the corresponding
     commissioner for a recognised lawâ
          (a) for the Customs Act 1901 (Cwlth) âthe Comptroller-
          General of Customs under that Act and the Commissioner of
          Taxation under the Taxation Administration Act 1953
          (Cwlth);
          (b) for another recognised law mentioned in schedule 1,
          part 1 âthe Commissioner of Taxation under the Taxation
          Administration Act 1953 (Cwlth);
          (c) for a recognised law mentioned in schedule 1, part 2
          âthe Commissioner for Australian Capital Territory
          Revenue under the Taxation Administration Act 1999 (ACT);
          (d) for a recognised law mentioned in schedule 1, part 3
          âthe Chief Commissioner, or Commissioner of State
          Revenue, under the Taxation Administration Act 1996 (NSW);
          (e) for a recognised law mentioned in schedule 1, part 4
          âthe Commissioner of Territory Revenue under the Taxation
          Administration Act 2007 (NT);
          (f) for a recognised law mentioned in schedule 1, part 5
          âthe Commissioner of State Taxation under the Taxation
          Administration Act 1996 (SA);
          (g) for a recognised law mentioned in schedule 1, part 6
          âthe Commissioner of State Revenue under the Taxation
          Administration Act 1997 (Tas);
          (h) for a recognised law mentioned in schedule 1, part 7
          âthe Commissioner of State Revenue under the Taxation
          Administration Act 1997 (Vic);
          (i) for a recognised law mentioned in schedule 1, part 8
          âthe Commissioner of State Revenue appointed as mentioned
          in the Taxation Administration Act 2003 (WA), section 6.
Expenses for attendanceâAct, s 88

chunks.title: Regulation 10 - Expenses for attendanceâAct, s 88
chunks.text:
(1) For section 88 (7) of the Act, the following expenses are
     prescribed for a person who is required to attend a placeâ
          (a) expenses the person incurs travelling to and from the
          place;
          (b) if it is necessary for the person to be away from the
          personâs place of residence to attend the placeâ
               (i) expenses the person incurs for accommodation
               and meals; and
               (ii) loss of the personâs earnings, or
               additional expenses the person incurs, while away
               from the personâs place of residence to attend
               the place.
     (2) The amount of the expenses the person is entitled to be paid is
     the amount payable under the Uniform Civil Procedure (Fees)
     Regulation 2019, part 3, asâ
          (a) for an expense mentioned in subsection (1) (a) âa
          travelling allowance; and
          (b) for an expense mentioned in subsection (1) (b) (i)
          âan accommodation allowance; and
          (c) for an expense mentioned in subsection (1) (b) (ii)
          âan attendance allowance.
     (3) For subsection (2), a reference in the Uniform Civil Procedure
     (Fees) Regulation 2019, part 3 to the court is taken to be a
     reference to the place the person is required to attend.
Way to give royalty document, and when royalty document is given, to
commissionerâAct, ss 143 and 144

chunks.title: Regulation 11 - Way to give royalty document, and when royalty document is given, to commissionerâAct, ss 143 and 144
chunks.main_structural_heading: Way to give royalty document, and when royalty document is given, to commissionerâAct, ss 143 and 144
chunks.text:
(1) This section applies to giving a document to the commissioner
     under a royalty law.
     (2) For section 143 (1) (d) of the Act, giving the document to the
     chief executive or a public service officer of the resources
     department, at an office of the resources department, is prescribed.
     (3) For section 144 (1) (d) of the Act, when the document is given to
     the chief executive or public service officer at the office is
     prescribed.
     (4) In this sectionâ
     "resources department" means the department in which a resources law
     is administered.
Non-application of s 147 of Act

chunks.title: Regulation 12 - Non-application of s 147 of Act
chunks.text:
Section 147 (1) of the Act does not apply to a taxpayer if the taxpayer is not
required to pay the tax for an instrument, transaction or matter underâ
     (a) for a liability to pay a tax, other than payroll tax or a
     royaltyâan agreement between the taxpayers liable to pay the tax
     for the instrument, transaction or matter; or
     (b) an Act relating to the instrument, transaction or matter; or
     (c) a court order or decision of QCAT.
Ways documents may be given by commissionerâAct, s 148

chunks.title: Regulation 13 - Ways documents may be given by commissionerâAct, s 148
chunks.main_structural_heading: Ways documents may be given by commissionerâAct, s 148
chunks.text:
For section 148 (1) (e) of the Act, the circumstances prescribed are thatâ
     (a) the document relates to a tax law; and
     (b) the person, or the personâs tax agent, has consented to the
     document being given using the approved information system; and
     (c) the document is made available in a format that can be saved and
     stored outside the approved information system.
When document is taken to be given by commissionerâAct, s 149

chunks.title: Regulation 14 - When document is taken to be given by commissionerâAct, s 149
chunks.main_structural_heading: When document is taken to be given by commissionerâAct, s 149
chunks.text:
(1) For section 149 (1) (d) of the Act, the date prescribed for a
     document made available using an approved information system isâ
          (a) the day the commissioner gives the person notice the
          document is available to be accessed using the approved
          information system; or
          (b) if the person satisfies the commissioner that, on the
          day mentioned in paragraph (a), the approved information
          system was not available to be accessedâthe first day
          after the notice is given that the document is able to be
          accessed using the approved information system.
               Examples for paragraph (b)â
                         1 Planned system maintenance
                         or an unplanned system outage
                         affects the approved
                         information system and
                         prevents it being accessed.
                         In this case, the approved
                         information system itself was
                         not available to be accessed.
                         2 The approved information
                         system is functioning
                         normally, but the person does
                         not have access to the
                         internet. In this case, the
                         approved information system
                         is available to be accessed
                         and the person is taken to
                         have accessed the document.
     (2) For subsection (1), notice given to the person by email or a text
     message is taken to be given to the person on the day the email or
     text message is sent.
